import MethodEndpoint from "@theme/ApiExplorer/MethodEndpoint";
import ParamsDetails from "@theme/ParamsDetails";
import RequestSchema from "@theme/RequestSchema";
import StatusCodes from "@theme/StatusCodes";
import OperationTabs from "@theme/OperationTabs";
import TabItem from "@theme/TabItem";
import Heading from "@theme/Heading";

<Heading
  as={"h1"}
  className={"openapi__heading"}
  children={"Register Analytics Event"}
>
</Heading>

<MethodEndpoint
  method={"post"}
  path={"/api/widget/projects/{projectId}/analytics"}
  context={"endpoint"}
>
  
</MethodEndpoint>



Registers analytics events for a project to enable tracking of user interactions, conversation flow, and system performance. These events are used to populate analytics dashboards in AI Findr Hub, helping you understand user behavior and optimize your AI assistant experience.

**Required Fields:**
- `action` (string): The type of event being registered. See available actions below.
- `conversationId` (string): The conversation ID where this event occurred
- `datetime` (string): Event timestamp in RFC3339 (ISO 8601) format

**Available Actions:**
- `query:initial`: First user query in a conversation
- `query:suggestion`: User selected a suggested query from the suggestions list
- `query:followup`: User sent a follow-up message in an ongoing conversation
- `response:generated`: AI assistant generated a response with sources and reasoning
- `feedback:select`: User selected a feedback option (positive/negative/neutral) before submitting
- `feedback:submit`: User submitted detailed feedback with optional text and selected options
- `click:responselink`: User clicked a link within the AI assistant response
- `click:sourcelink`: User clicked a source link in the response
- `click:cta:[componentId]`: User clicked a CTA component (replace [componentId] with actual ID)
- `form:submit`: User submitted data through a form presented by the AI assistant
- `widget:open`: User opened the AI assistant widget

**Payload Structure:**
Each action type has its own specific payload structure with relevant fields. The payload contains event-specific data such as queries, responses, feedback details, click targets, or form submissions. All additional fields beyond the required ones are stored in the analytics payload for dashboard consumption.

**Analytics Usage:**
Registered events appear in the AI Findr Hub analytics dashboard, enabling insights into conversation patterns, user engagement, knowledge gaps, and system performance. Use this data to optimize content, improve user experience, and measure AI assistant effectiveness.

<Heading
  id={"request"}
  as={"h2"}
  className={"openapi-tabs__heading"}
  children={"Request"}
>
</Heading>

<ParamsDetails
  parameters={[{"description":"Project identifier","in":"path","name":"projectId","required":true,"schema":{"type":"string"}}]}
>
  
</ParamsDetails>

<RequestSchema
  title={"Body"}
  body={{"content":{"application/json":{"schema":{"properties":{"action":{"enum":["query:initial","query:suggestion","query:followup","response:generated","feedback:select","feedback:submit","click:responselink","click:sourcelink","click:cta:*","form:submit","widget:open"],"type":"string"},"conversationId":{"type":"string"},"datetime":{"type":"string"},"payload":{"additionalProperties":true,"type":"object"}},"type":"object"}}},"description":"Analytics event data with action, conversation ID, timestamp, and action-specific payload","required":true}}
>
  
</RequestSchema>
